page.title: 03A Mill on the Stour
page.content: The first working mill on the river Stour is Purns Mill.Many mills have been closed down and one of these is Ecclife Mill.Here, a system of hatces controlled the water levels for water wheel drive.The mill was modernised with turbines in 1904 and continued working until the very cold winter of the early 1940's.The river froze and thick snow lay on the ice.The snow melted flooded the mill and large peices of flooting ice wrecked the hatches.The machinery was removed and the mill was sold to a local farmer as a store and stable.The mill is now an unusual house with water on three sides of its garden.
